topic_metadata.title: How can I put a '\n' into a caption?

posts.name: cord
posts.cooked:
gemini and perplexity are claiming that cr/lf (= \n or linefeed) is supported in a caption, but I can’t make it work. I’d like to break the following caption into two lines

#figure(
  grid(
    columns: 2,
    image("f.counts.cumulative.png", width: 90%),
    image("f.counts.weekly.png", width: 90%)
  ),
  caption: [Cumulative Thomisidae counts:
  control: orange, SNH: blue]
) <figure.temporal>

Is it possible? Thank you.
posts.raw:

posts.cooked:
Are you looking for a line break?

#figure(
  grid(
    columns: 2,
    gutter: 1em,
    rect(), rect(),
  ),
  caption: [Cumulative Thomisidae counts: \
    control: orange, SNH: blue],
) <figure.temporal>

For sub figures there is subpar – Typst Universe.
posts.raw:
Are you looking for a [line break](https://typst.app/docs/reference/text/linebreak/)?

```typ
#figure(
  grid(
    columns: 2,
    gutter: 1em,
    rect(), rect(),
  ),
  caption: [Cumulative Thomisidae counts: \
    control: orange, SNH: blue],
) <figure.temporal>
```

![image|255x94](upload://6HXLQmPBmFA8BIwM9Y03YVdIA77.png)

For sub figures there is https://typst.app/universe/package/subpar.
